Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Oliver Martinez. This is my first time here.
Hello, Oliver! It's great to meet you. How are you feeling today?
I'm feeling a mix of excitement and anxiety about the new semester.
That's completely normal! Starting a new semester can be quite overwhelming at times. What are some of the things that are causing you anxiety?
I'm taking on a lot this semester—my psychology classes are demanding, and I'm also leading a couple of volunteer projects.
It sounds like you have a full plate! Have you had a chance to talk to anyone about how you're feeling?
Not really. I'm a bit embarrassed to say that I'm struggling.
There's no need to feel embarrassed. Many students face similar challenges. Would you like to explore ways to better manage your responsibilities?
Hi again. I'm feeling more stressed this week.
Hi, Oliver! I'm glad you came back. What's been going on this week?
I just can't seem to catch a break. I'm worried about meeting all my deadlines, and I've been irritable with my friends and family.
That sounds really tough. It can be hard to balance everything. Are you feeling like you can connect with your friends, especially your sister Sofia?
Not really. I feel guilty for not being there for her like I used to. I just can't find the energy.
It's understandable to feel that way under pressure. It's okay to prioritize taking care of yourself. Have you thought about what you might do to address these feelings with her?
Hello, I had a really hard time this week.
Hi, Oliver! I'm sorry to hear that. What happened?
I had a breakdown after a volunteer event when my friend Jake confronted me about not being around lately.
That sounds really intense. How did that conversation make you feel?
I felt attacked at first but then I realized I was just shutting everyone out. I haven't been managing my responsibilities well.
Acknowledging that can be a difficult step. Do you feel like you're able to express these feelings to Jake?
I didn't, and now I feel regretful for not being open. I'm worried this will affect our friendship.
It's completely normal to fear how others will perceive you, but sharing your feelings could actually strengthen your friendship. Have you thought about reaching out to him?
Hi! I finally talked to Jake, and it helped. I apologized for shutting him out.
That's wonderful to hear, Oliver! How did that conversation go?
It was really good. I opened up about the pressure I've been feeling, and he was really supportive.
That's fantastic! It sounds like you found some relief in being honest. What did he suggest?
He offered to help with the volunteer projects and get back on track together. I feel relieved, but I'm still anxious about balancing everything.
That's understandable. It's okay to still feel some anxiety. Just take it one step at a time and remember to lean on your support system when you need it.
Thanks for your advice. I really appreciate it!
You're welcome! I'm here to help. Don't hesitate to check in again if you need to talk.
